conclusion: Need to analyze motion and positions based on velocity-time graphs to determine relative position at t=10s.
Car A accelerates from 0 to 40 m/s in the first 10s, then maintains a constant speed of 40 m/s.
Car B accelerates at a constant rate from 0, reaching approximately 40 m/s at around t=20s, and continues accelerating.
Calculate displacement for Car A from t=0 to t=10s as 200m using area under the curve.
Calculate displacement for Car B from t=0 to t=10s as 100m using area under the curve.
Calculate displacement for Car A from t=10s to t=30s as 800m using area under the curve.
Calculate displacement for Car B from t=10s to t=30s as 800m using area under the curve.
Total displacement for Car A from t=0 to t=30s is 1000m.
Total displacement for Car B from t=0 to t=30s is 900m.
Cars are side by side at t=30s according to the problem statement.
Car B must have started 100m ahead of Car A at t=0s due to discrepancy in total displacement.
At t=10s, Car A has traveled 200m from its starting point.
At t=10s, Car B has traveled 100m from its starting point but started 100m ahead, so it is 200m from Car A's starting point.
At t=10s, Car A and Car B are at the same position, side by side.
Reconsider calculations against problem statement that cars are side by side at t=30s.
Re-examining graph suggests Car B travels more distance than Car A from t=10s to t=30s, placing Car A ahead at t=10s.
Final conclusion: Car A is ahead of Car B at t=10s.
